citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A written program of veterinary care was not available for review at time of inspection. The facility representative stated
the licensee does employ a part-time attending veterinarian. Failure to maintain required records impedes APHIS officials'
ability to perform their duties and fully assess welfare and planned veterinary care of regulated animals. Each dealer shall
employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time attending veterinarian, the formal
arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary care and regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the
dealer.
Correct by 12 March 2024.

The facility representative stated that certain documents could not be found for inspection and surmised that a previously
employed individual likely had taken the records. These required records include the acquisition records of regulated
animals. Failure to maintain required records impedes APHIS officials' ability to perform their duties and fully assess
welfare and traceability of regulated animals. Every dealer shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully
and correctly disclose information concerning animals that are purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased or
otherwise in his or her possession or under his control.
Correct from this date forward of 27 February 2024.

A developed contingency plan was not available at time of inspection. Contingency plans help prepare facilities on how to
provide humane handling of animals during emergencies. The dealer must develop a complete contingency plan tailored
to the facility and animals on hand. All employees must be trained on their roles and responsibilities within this plan and
the facility must maintain documentation of annual reviews of the plan.
Correct by 28 March 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A written program of veterinary care was not available for review at time of inspection. The facility representative stated 
the licensee does employ a part-time attending veterinarian. Failure to maintain required records impedes APHIS officials' 
ability to perform their duties and fully assess welfare and planned veterinary care of regulated animals. Each dealer shall 
employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time attending veterinarian, the formal 
arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary care and regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the 
dealer.  
 
Correct by 12 March 2024. 
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility representative stated that certain documents could not be found for inspection and surmised that a previously 
employed individual likely had taken the records. These required records include the acquisition records of regulated 
animals. Failure to maintain required records impedes APHIS officials' ability to perform their duties and fully assess 
welfare and traceability of regulated animals. Every dealer shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully 
and correctly disclose information concerning animals that are purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased or 
otherwise in his or her possession or under his control. 
 
Correct from this date forward of 27 February 2024. 
2.134(a) 
   
Contingency planning. 
A developed contingency plan was not available at time of inspection. Contingency plans help prepare facilities on how to 
provide humane handling of animals during emergencies. The dealer must develop a complete contingency plan tailored 
to the facility and animals on hand. All employees must be trained on their roles and responsibilities within this plan and 
the facility must maintain documentation of annual reviews of the plan.

Correct by 28 March 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
